info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 8:29PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDowell, northeastern Rutherford, northwestern Cleveland and south central Burke Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 829 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Morganton, or 9 miles southwest of South Mountains State Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... South Mountains State Park, Casar, Polkville, Thermal City, Dysartsville, Sunshine and Fero. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for western and the Piedmont of North Carolina.
